The REDD+ Project contributes to climate change mitigation by preventing deforestation and supporting sustainable land management.
Settlers benefit from improved health posts, housing, drinking water, and increased income through marketable products.
The RA5 Center provides safe drinking water and sanitation, contributing to resilient infrastructure and sustainable industrialization.
Teachers benefit from improved transportation, governance support, financial aid for higher education, and school kits, enhancing educational delivery.
The project established an integrated forest and land management system involving 312 communities, achieving 80% captain participation and increasing food production by 1,500 tons.
